The node writes: "2pi log |J_n(q)|/n -> Vol(S^3 \ K) as n -> infinity with q = exp(2pi i/n)."

The standard Murakami-Murakami (2001) statement is:

  lim_{N -> inf} (2pi / N) * log |J_N(K; e^{2pi i/N})| = Vol(S^3 \ K)

The node's formula can be parsed as: [2pi * log |J_n(q)|] / n, which equals (2pi/n) * log |J_n| and is correct up to notation.

However, the node writes this specifically for "the figure-eight knot complement." The original Kashaev (1997) conjecture was indeed stated for the figure-eight knot as a specific example, but the Murakami-Murakami (2001) generalization states it for ALL hyperbolic knots. By restricting to the figure-eight knot, the node obscures the generality of the VC while simultaneously claiming a general connection. More importantly, the VC as stated by Murakami-Murakami uses the SIMPLICIAL VOLUME (which equals the hyperbolic volume for hyperbolic knots), not "Vol(S^3 \ K)" which could be ambiguous. For non-hyperbolic knots, the simplicial volume is zero, and the conjecture states that the limit is zero â€” there is no "exponential growth" for non-hyperbolic knots.

Additionally, the node uses "J_n(q)" as if J_n is a function of an independent variable q, when in the VC the evaluation point q = e^{2pi i/n} is DETERMINED by n. Writing "J_n(q)" suggests q is a free parameter, which reinforces the erroneous impression that one can take q to be a fixed real positive number (the BLM regime) and still have the VC apply.
